meanings.definition: The weight in tons of a ship or its cargo.
meanings.sent1: The ship's tonnage was so heavy that it could barely stay afloat.
meanings.sent2: The tonnage of the cargo ship was 10,000 tons.
meanings.sent3: The tonnage of the ship was so immense that even the whales were impressed.
meanings.sent4: The tonnage of responsibility weighed heavily on the captain's shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The tonnage of the cargo was like a mountain of steel on the dock.

meanings.definition: The capacity of a ship expressed in tons.
meanings.sent1: The large tanker had a tonnage of 50,000 tons.
meanings.sent2: The tonnage of the cruise ship allowed for many passengers.
meanings.sent3: The tonnage of the ship was like a giant bathtub waiting to be filled with water.
meanings.sent4: The tonnage of the vessel was a testament to human engineering.
meanings.sent5: The tonnage of the ship was like a floating city on the sea.

meanings.definition: The total weight of a shipment.
meanings.sent1: The tonnage of the goods on board exceeded all expectations.
meanings.sent2: The tonnage of the cargo plane was carefully calculated for the flight.
meanings.sent3: The tonnage of the shipment was so massive that it took multiple cranes to unload.
meanings.sent4: The tonnage of the delivery was a burden on the warehouse's storage capacity.
meanings.sent5: The tonnage of the package felt like a heavy secret waiting to be revealed.
